 I posted this 
 http://www.4forums.com/political/showpost.php?p=295123&postcount=28
 Showing where in Ephesians women are to be subject to thier husbands in all things. 
 
Ephesians Chapter 5
 5:22. Let women be subject to their husbands, as to the Lord: 
 5:23. Because the husband is the head of the wife, as Christ is the head of the church. He is the saviour of his body. 
 5:24. Therefore as the church is subject to Christ: so also let the wives be to their husbands in all things.

 I then back it up with a quote from Jesus
 
matthew 19:5 And said, For this cause shall a man leave father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife: and they twain shall be one flesh?

 I take these above passages to mean that when a man and woman get married they become one person with the man at the head making all the decisions. I take it to mean that once they are married the women then gives up her free will to her husband.
 My question is this
 If someone believes that the bible is the literal, infallable,and inerrant word of God should we hold them to this belief if the enspouse this belief using the bible to challenge those beliefs?
charlie horse

... I take these above passages to mean that when a man and woman get married they become one person with the man at the head making all the decisions. I take it to mean that once they are married the women then gives up her free will to her husband...

 Nope. Paul further went on to explain WHY women were to be in subjection: because woman (Eve) was thoroughly deceived first.
 
 There's nothing to suggest that joint decisions can't be made in a marriage - it is, after all, a marriage - or that wives can't think independently. It means that where a crucial decision is to be made, and there isn't a consensus, then the husband should take the lead.
 
 That's if you believe it all in the first place.

Which is why I gave this explanation which you obviously didn't like Matthew.
 ARCHANGELYou see Matthew, I'm a bible literalist, not a bible legalist. There is a huge difference you know. You are a legalist so you take the bible in a legalistic interpretation to the extremes to fit a negative belief in what it is saying, when it is convenient that is. When the bible condemns homosexuality, you brush it off as not literal at all but only figurative or just plain wrong. 
 
 In my marriage, according to the bible, God will hold me as the head of the household responsible for my families stability and security. That doesn't make me the Lord over my family and give me the right to rule with an iron fist like a dictator. I am to love and serve my family as the Lord loves and serves the Church.
 
 As for my wife, she is my help mate, my equal. My councilor whom I discuss every decision that effects our family with before making a decision. Her opinion, perspective and wisdom is key to US making wise decisions for our family. If there is an issue that we just can't agree on together, she will actually tell me to do what I think is right because she understands that God will ultimately hold me responsible as the head of the household. 
 
 It isn't about being in charge or being the boss for me at all. It's about going before my Lord as His child whom He has entrusted other precious children to. Those people being my wife and children. That's why I walked not in front of my daughters as they grew up, leading like some general, but walked by their side guiding them as another child of God and guided them to HIS THRONE OF GRACE because I am finite and may not always be here. But jesus is forever and can always be counted on to be perfect, Holy and Righteous. Not so with me, a flawed human being whom my daughters have seen fall short of perfection on many levels.
 
 But just as I have lovingly nurtured them through their growing pains, so have they loved me through mine. That is what being a christian father and husband is all about Matthew. Not being the biggest bully in the neighborhood and lording my position over my wife and kids as I beat them into submission to my singular will as you so incorrectly see it to be.

If someone says they believe the bible is the literal, infallable,and inerrant word of God are they then trapped by that belief?

 Rationally, they would be. In reality, they don't think so.
 
 The Bible literalist will lie, obfuscate, qualify, and ignore Biblical passages to his or her little heart's content just to come up with what that person already believes is true.
 
 For example, According to the Bible, God said that nobody should work on the sabbath. According to the Bible, Moses found a man picking up sticks on the sabbath. According to the Bible, God Himself declared that a man picking up sticks on the sabbath should be put to death.
 
 Bible literalists will retell this story with any number of explanations. "It was a different time" is very common. "That was because he directly disobeyed God's word" is one that our friend Archie uses. Whatever the explanation, today's literalists will never push for the stoning of a sabbath-worker, regardless of what the Bible actually says.

Of course I take the bible literally Matt. But what is most important is to see it through Gods eyes, so to speak. To interpret it according to how God intended it to be interpreted.

 But who determines "how God intended it to be interpreted"? Who is regarded as the authority of "how God intended it to be interpreted"? God? No, it can't be, because God's meaning is what is in dispute. The interpreters are the ones who determine "God's meaning." Therefore I can have my interpretation, you can have your interpretation, the Pope can have his interpretation, and any random nutjob can have his interpretation, too, and everybody will have -- at least on these grounds -- equal claim to being right. Pretty dumb, huh?

 So because you don't like a particular interpretation, even if it is the only logical one, you feel that you are correct in rejecting what the Bible actually says and insisting that God meant something else.  I think the only passage you need comes from Mark 7.
 
 
 14Again Jesus called the crowd to him and said, "Listen to me, everyone, and understand this. 15Nothing outside a man can make him 'unclean' by going into him. Rather, it is what comes out of a man that makes him 'unclean.' "[f] 
 
 17After he had left the crowd and entered the house, his disciples asked him about this parable. 18"Are you so dull?" he asked. "Don't you see that nothing that enters a man from the outside can make him 'unclean'? 19For it doesn't go into his heart but into his stomach, and then out of his body." (In saying this, Jesus declared all foods "clean.") 
 
 20He went on: "What comes out of a man is what makes him 'unclean.' 21For from within, out of men's hearts, come evil thoughts, sexual immorality, theft, murder, adultery, 22greed, malice, deceit, lewdness, envy, slander, arrogance and folly. 23All these evils come from inside and make a man 'unclean.' "

 
 This passage is viewed as saying that all the 'unclean' foods (shellfish, rare steak etc) would no longer be considered 'unclean'. However it says much more. This passage is saying that it is what is in your heart that matters. Do you love or hate? Homosexual love is still love.  Rom 1:21 For even though they knew God, they did not honor Him as God or give thanks, but they became futile in their speculations, and their foolish heart was darkened. 
 Rom 1:22 Professing to be wise, they became fools, 
 Rom 1:23 and exchanged the glory of the incorruptible God for an image in the form of corruptible man and of birds and four-footed animals and crawling creatures. 
 Rom 1:24 Therefore God gave them over in the lusts of their hearts to impurity, so that their bodies would be dishonored among them. 
 Rom 1:25 For they exchanged the truth of God for a lie, and worshiped and served the creature rather than the Creator, who is blessed forever. Amen. 
 Rom 1:26 For this reason God gave them over to degrading passions; for their women exchanged the natural function for that which is unnatural, 
 Rom 1:27 and in the same way also the men abandoned the natural function of the woman and burned in their desire toward one another, men with men committing indecent acts and receiving in their own persons the due penalty of their error.

 Rom 1:31 without understanding, untrustworthy, unloving, unmerciful;

 Rom 1:23 and exchanged the glory of the incorruptible God for an image in the form of corruptible man and of birds and four-footed animals and crawling creatures. 
 Rom 1:24 Therefore God gave them over in the lusts of their hearts to impurity, so that their bodies would be dishonored among them. 
 Rom 1:25 For they exchanged the truth of God for a lie, and worshiped and served the creature rather than the Creator, who is blessed forever. Amen. 
 Rom 1:26 For this reason God gave them over to degrading passions; for their women exchanged the natural function for that which is unnatural, 
 Rom 1:27 and in the same way also the men abandoned the natural function of the woman and burned in their desire toward one another, men with men committing indecent acts and receiving in their own persons the due penalty of their error. 
 Rom 1:28 And just as they did not see fit to acknowledge God any longer, God gave them over to a depraved mind, to do those things which are not proper, 
 Rom 1:29 being filled with all unrighteousness, wickedness, greed, evil; full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, malice; {they are} gossips, 
 Rom 1:30 slanderers, haters of God, insolent, arrogant, boastful, inventors of evil, disobedient to parents, 
 Rom 1:31 without understanding, untrustworthy, unloving, unmerciful; 
 Rom 1:32 and although they know the ordinance of God, that those who practice such things are worthy of death, they not only do the same, but also give hearty approval to those who practice them.

If it brings you comfort, wonderful. But all I see is a crutch of your own design. You'd be much better off IMO not wasting your time with ear ticklers. As it stands, all I can think is that you get a much needed sense of community and outlet for doing charitable deeds that's often hard to find in the atheistic community. I could be wrong though.
 
 But as said, there's no reason for most of us to waste time fellowshipping with you or doing anything that our selfish hearts don't desire since we'll be sitting next to you in your version of heaven.
 
 I'm reminded of the Jehovah's Witness lady who spent 2 years talking to my fundy wife. She pushed the notion that the lake of fire would utterly consume the souls of those of us who were damned.

 I mean, seriously, what's to fear about a few moments of possible suffering and then utter oblivion?

 Heh. Considering all the women out there who tend to defer to their husbands by default, apparently not all women see marriage the way critics of the Bible do. Sure, there are a lot of bad husbands out there, and that's just as un-Biblical as anything. But I don't recall ever seeing a marriage that was truly democratic and equal in terms of the husband and wife--someone almost always ends up 'wearing the pants' in the family. (And sometimes it's the wife.) But this observation begs the question that, if such is the case, then what's WRONG with a marriage where the wife defers to the husband?
 
 I think this is something that nobody ever really discusses much because it's become so non-politically correct to do so, but from my observations most marriages do involve the husband having the final say on things. I'm not making a value judgment on that; just noting observation. It seems there are a lot of women out there who prefer it that way. Part of that may be that men tend to marry wives more that aren't dominant in personality, and so that deference to the husband just tends to happen by default as a result of personalities.
Zardoz

Isn't that what faith and belief is all about? Faith does not require proof, support, or documentation.

 
 I'm not attacking your faith or beliefs, I'm questioning the logic of using a known work (the Christian) bible, and then turning around and stating you don't believe in a huge chunk of what it states.
 
 Why not simply write a new book and claim the old one was perverted and lead to wrong conclusions (which is what the Jehovah's Witnesses did). Or, 'find' a new companion work that clarifies what the bible means (like what the Mormons did).
 
 I see your faith akin to someone stating:
 The Roman Empire was the most awsome thing that ever existed.
 Except that they had blood sports, and an emperor, taxes, an army bent on conquest, was based in the underbelly of the wonderful continent of Europe (really, who'd want to live in Italy, it smells there and the weather is foul), their clothing was horrendous and lacked any fashion sense, etc, etc, etc...
 
 To me, it seems like you're simply clinging to some vestige of Christianity as one would 'hide in the closet'. Afraid to find a more compatable faith that would suit you're actual beliefs.
 
 Faith should require some reason for having it.
 
 As I said, the only thing I can think of would be a sense of community, an outlet for charity and the ability to 'hide' in a bigoted Christian culture by claiming to be one too.
 
 My use of documentation may have been misunderstood.
 By it I mean, your 'bible' should be clear on where gays stand...not be riddled with verse on how wrong it is.
 It's like a black person joining the KKK.
 
 Makes nooo sense.

The bible is not to be taken literally. The bible only tells Gods story it is nota rule book set in stone. See to me God is a loving father who would not burn or kill His children no matter what they have done, say, believe, or are...

 Excuse me, Matt S, but this is clearly religion and faith on your own terms, not your God's.
 
 If the bible is not to be taken literally (and you didn't qualify any part - therefore the whole), then the whole lot is allegory, fable, and every other sort of fiction. From that you deduce a god on which you bend your life. If the bible is not to be taken literally, then Christ never existed other than as a metaphor, and, inter alia, neither does your god exist.
 
 You can't claim to have a religious faith based on the bible, and then interpret the bible to suit your own ends. Your case in point is that your god will accept you no matter what you do or are. In other words, there is no biblical moral standard constraining your actions. That is sheer hypocrisy.
 
 I can only conclude that you didn't really mean to say what you did, i.e. without qualification.
